qas.question: What is the term for the head of China's government?
What is another name for the Republic of China?
Whose consent is not required for the Taiwanese premier to take office?
Who is both head of state and the head of government in France?
Who is appointed by the president and approved by the legislature in Taiwan?

context: This contrasts with the presidential system, in which the president (or equivalent) is both the head of state and the head of the government. In some presidential or semi-presidential systems, such as those of France, Russia or South Korea, <b3_0>the prime minister<b3_0/> is an official generally appointed by the president but usually approved by the <a2_0>legislature<a2_0/> and responsible for carrying out the directives of the president and managing the civil service. The head of government of the People's Republic of China is referred to as the <a0_0>Premier of the State Council<a0_0/> and <b4_0>the premier<b4_0/> of the Republic of China (<a1_0>Taiwan<a1_0/>) is also appointed by the president, but requires no approval by the legislature.
